metadata.name: Permission Misconfiguration Reconnaissance Via Findstr.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects usage of findstr with the "EVERYONE" or "BUILTIN" keywords. This was seen being used in combination with "icacls" and other utilities to spot misconfigured files or folders permissions.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND ((endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\find.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\findstr.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('find\\.exe', 'findstr\\.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('"everyone"')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('''everyone''')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('"builtin\\\\"')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('''builtin\\\\'''))) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('icacls ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('findstr ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('everyone'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of findstr with the "EVERYONE" or "BUILTIN" keywords. This was seen being used in combination with "icacls" and other utilities to spot misconfigured files or folders permissions.
